description: Read, write, and sync files stored in Google Drive from your mobile and web apps.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Get AccessToken

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client ID

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Client secret

args.name: code
args.info: Code you received from Google after the user granted access

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The same redirect URL as in received Code step.

blocks.name: refreshToken
blocks.description: Get new accessToken by refreshToken

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client ID

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Client secret

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: A token that you can use to obtain a new access token. Refresh tokens are valid until the user revokes access. Again, this field is only present in this response if you set the access_type parameter to offline in the initial request to Google's authorization server.

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Get new accessToken by refreshToken

args.name: token
args.info: The token can be an access token or a refresh token. If the token is an access token and it has a corresponding refresh token, the refresh token will also be revoked.

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Gets information about the user, the user's Drive, and system capabilities.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields. Examples: kind, user, storageQuota, importFormats, exportFormats, maxImportSizes, maxUploadSize, appInstalled, folderColorPalette, teamDriveThemes

blocks.name: getStartPageToken
blocks.description: Gets the starting pageToken for listing future changes.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The ID of the Team Drive for which the starting pageToken for listing future changes from that Team Drive will be returned.

blocks.name: getChanges
blocks.description: Lists the changes for a user or Team Drive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.

args.name: includeCorpusRemovals
args.info: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file. (Default: false)

args.name: includeRemoved
args.info: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access. (Default: true)

args.name: includeTeamDriveItems
args.info: Whether Team Drive files or changes should be included in results. (Default: false)

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of changes to return per page. Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive. (Default: 100)

args.name: restrictToMyDrive
args.info: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive. (Default: false)

args.name: spaces
args.info: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The Team Drive from which changes will be returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the Team Drive; use the combined Team Drive ID and change ID as an identifier.

blocks.name: subscribeToUserChanges
blocks.description: Subscribes to changes for a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.

args.name: includeCorpusRemovals
args.info: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file. (Default: false)

args.name: includeRemoved
args.info: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access. (Default: true)

args.name: includeTeamDriveItems
args.info: Whether Team Drive files or changes should be included in results. (Default: false)

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of changes to return per page. Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive. (Default: 100)

args.name: restrictToMyDrive
args.info: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive. (Default: false)

args.name: spaces
args.info: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The Team Drive from which changes will be returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the Team Drive; use the combined Team Drive ID and change ID as an identifier.

blocks.name: stopWatchingChannelResources
blocks.description: Stop watching resources through this channel

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: kind
args.info: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource. Value: the fixed string "api#channel".

args.name: id
args.info: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

args.name: resourceUri
args.info: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

args.name: token
args.info: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

args.name: expiration
args.info: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

args.name: address
args.info: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

args.name: payload
args.info: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

args.name: params
args.info: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

blocks.name: createFileComment
blocks.description: Creates a new comment on a file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: content
args.info: The plain text content of the comment. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed.

args.name: anchor
args.info: A region of the document represented as a JSON string. See anchor documentation for details on how to define and interpret anchor properties.

args.name: quotedFileContentValue
args.info: The quoted content itself. This is interpreted as plain text if set through the API.

blocks.name: deleteFileComment
blocks.description: Deletes a comment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

blocks.name: getFileSingleComment
blocks.description: Gets a comment by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: Whether to return deleted comments. Deleted comments will not include their original content. (Default: false)

blocks.name: getFileComments
blocks.description: Lists a file's comments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: Whether to include deleted comments. Deleted comments will not include their original content. (Default: false)

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of comments to return per page. Acceptable values are 1 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 20)

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

args.name: startModifiedTime
args.info: The minimum value of 'modifiedTime' for the result comments (RFC 3339 date-time).

blocks.name: updateFileComment
blocks.description: Lists a file's comments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: content
args.info: The plain text content of the comment. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed.

blocks.name: copyFile
blocks.description: Lists a file's comments.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: ignoreDefaultVisibility
args.info: Whether to ignore the domain's default visibility settings for the created file. Domain administrators can choose to make all uploaded files visible to the domain by default; this parameter bypasses that behavior for the request. Permissions are still inherited from parent folders. (Default: false)

args.name: keepRevisionForever
args.info: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive. (Default: false)

args.name: ocrLanguage
args.info: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: appProperties
args.info: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

args.name: thumbnailImage
args.info: The thumbnail data encoded with URL-safe Base64 (RFC 4648 section 5).

args.name: thumbnailMimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

args.name: description
args.info: A short description of the file.

args.name: mimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the file. Drive will attempt to automatically detect an appropriate value from uploaded content if no value is provided. The value cannot be changed unless a new revision is uploaded. If a file is created with a Google Doc MIME type, the uploaded content will be imported if possible. The supported import formats are published in the About resource.

args.name: modifiedTime
args.info: The last time the file was modified by anyone (RFC 3339 date-time). Note that setting modifiedTime will also update modifiedByMeTime for the user.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the file. This is not necessarily unique within a folder. Note that for immutable items such as the top level folders of Team Drives, My Drive root folder, and Application Data folder the name is constant.

args.name: parents
args.info: The IDs of the parent folders which contain the file. If not specified as part of a create request, the file will be placed directly in the My Drive folder. Update requests must use the addParents and removeParents parameters to modify the values.

args.name: properties
args.info: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are visible to all apps. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

args.name: starred
args.info: Whether the user has starred the file.

args.name: viewedByMeTime
args.info: The last time the file was viewed by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).

args.name: viewersCanCopyContent
args.info: Whether users with only reader or commenter permission can copy the file's content. This affects copy, download, and print operations.

args.name: writersCanShare
args.info: Whether users with only writer permission can modify the file's permissions. Not populated for Team Drive files.

blocks.name: createFile
blocks.description: Creates a new file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: uploadType
args.info: The type of upload request to the /upload URI. Acceptable values are: "media" - Simple upload. Upload the media only, without any metadata. "multipart" - Multipart upload. Upload both the media and its metadata, in a single request. "resumable" - Resumable upload. Upload the file in a resumable fashion, using a series of at least two requests where the first request includes the metadata.

args.name: ignoreDefaultVisibility
args.info: Whether to ignore the domain's default visibility settings for the created file. Domain administrators can choose to make all uploaded files visible to the domain by default; this parameter bypasses that behavior for the request. Permissions are still inherited from parent folders. (Default: false)

args.name: keepRevisionForever
args.info: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive. (Default: false)

args.name: ocrLanguage
args.info: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: useContentAsIndexableText
args.info: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text. (Default: false)

args.name: appProperties
args.info: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

args.name: indexableText
args.info: Text to be indexed for the file to improve fullText queries. This is limited to 128KB in length and may contain HTML elements.

args.name: thumbnailImage
args.info: The thumbnail data encoded with URL-safe Base64 (RFC 4648 section 5).

args.name: mimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

blocks.name: deleteFile
blocks.description: Permanently deletes a file owned by the user without moving it to the trash. If the file belongs to a Team Drive the user must be an organizer on the parent. If the target is a folder, all descendants owned by the user are also deleted.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

blocks.name: emptyTrash
blocks.description: Permanently deletes all of the user's trashed files.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

blocks.name: exportFile
blocks.description: Exports a Google Doc to the requested MIME type and returns the exported content.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: mimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the format requested for this export.

blocks.name: generateFileIds
blocks.description: Generates a set of file IDs which can be provided in create requests.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: count
args.info: The number of IDs to return. Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive. (Default: 10)

args.name: space
args.info: The space in which the IDs can be used to create new files. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.

blocks.name: getSingleFile
blocks.description: Gets a file's metadata or content by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: acknowledgeAbuse
args.info: Whether the user is acknowledging the risk of downloading known malware or other abusive files. This is only applicable when alt=media. (Default: false)

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

blocks.name: getFiles
blocks.description: Lists or searches files.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: corpora
args.info: Comma-separated list of bodies of items (files/documents) to which the query applies. Supported bodies are 'user', 'domain', 'teamDrive' and 'allTeamDrives'. 'allTeamDrives' must be combined with 'user'; all other values must be used in isolation. Prefer 'user' or 'teamDrive' to 'allTeamDrives' for efficiency.

args.name: corpus
args.info: The source of files to list. Deprecated: use 'corpora' instead. Acceptable values are: "domain": Files shared to the user's domain. "user": Files owned by or shared to the user.

args.name: includeTeamDriveItems
args.info: Whether Team Drive items should be included in results. (Default: false)

args.name: orderBy
args.info: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys are 'createdTime', 'folder', 'modifiedByMeTime', 'modifiedTime', 'name', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeTime', 'starred', and 'viewedByMeTime'. Each key sorts ascending by default, but may be reversed with the 'desc' modifier. Example usage: ?orderBy=folder,modifiedTime desc,name. Please note that there is a current limitation for users with approximately one million files in which the requested sort order is ignored.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of files to return per page. Partial or empty result pages are possible even before the end of the files list has been reached. Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive. (Default: 100)

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

args.name: query
args.info: A query for filtering the file results. See the "Search for Files" guide for supported syntax.

args.name: spaces
args.info: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpus. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: ID of Team Drive to search

blocks.name: updateFile
blocks.description: Updates a file's metadata and/or content with patch semantics

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: uploadType
args.info: The type of upload request to the /upload URI. Acceptable values are: "media" - Simple upload. Upload the media only, without any metadata. "multipart" - Multipart upload. Upload both the media and its metadata, in a single request. "resumable" - Resumable upload. Upload the file in a resumable fashion, using a series of at least two requests where the first request includes the metadata.

args.name: addParents
args.info: A comma-separated list of parent IDs to add.

args.name: keepRevisionForever
args.info: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive. (Default: false)

args.name: ocrLanguage
args.info: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

args.name: removeParents
args.info: A comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: useContentAsIndexableText
args.info: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text. (Default: false)

args.name: appProperties
args.info: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are private to the requesting app. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

args.name: indexableText
args.info: Text to be indexed for the file to improve fullText queries. This is limited to 128KB in length and may contain HTML elements.

args.name: thumbnailImage
args.info: The thumbnail data encoded with URL-safe Base64 (RFC 4648 section 5).

args.name: mimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the thumbnail.

args.name: description
args.info: A short description of the file.

args.name: folderColorRgb
args.info: The color for a folder as an RGB hex string. The supported colors are published in the folderColorPalette field of the About resource. If an unsupported color is specified, the closest color in the palette will be used instead.

args.name: mimeType
args.info: The MIME type of the file. Drive will attempt to automatically detect an appropriate value from uploaded content if no value is provided. The value cannot be changed unless a new revision is uploaded. If a file is created with a Google Doc MIME type, the uploaded content will be imported if possible. The supported import formats are published in the About resource.

args.name: modifiedTime
args.info: The last time the file was modified by anyone (RFC 3339 date-time). Note that setting modifiedTime will also update modifiedByMeTime for the user.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the file. This is not necessarily unique within a folder. Note that for immutable items such as the top level folders of Team Drives, My Drive root folder, and Application Data folder the name is constant.

args.name: originalFilename
args.info: The original filename of the uploaded content if available, or else the original value of the name field. This is only available for files with binary content in Drive.

args.name: properties
args.info: A collection of arbitrary key-value pairs which are visible to all apps. Entries with null values are cleared in update and copy requests.

args.name: starred
args.info: Whether the user has starred the file.

args.name: trashed
args.info: Whether the file has been trashed, either explicitly or from a trashed parent folder. Only the owner may trash a file, and other users cannot see files in the owner's trash.

args.name: viewedByMeTime
args.info: The last time the file was viewed by the user (RFC 3339 date-time).

args.name: viewersCanCopyContent
args.info: Whether users with only reader or commenter permission can copy the file's content. This affects copy, download, and print operations.

args.name: writersCanShare
args.info: Whether users with only writer permission can modify the file's permissions. Not populated for Team Drive files.

blocks.name: subscribeToFileChanges
blocks.description: Subscribes to changes to a file

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: acknowledgeAbuse
args.info: Whether the user is acknowledging the risk of downloading known malware or other abusive files. This is only applicable when alt=media. (Default: false)

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: kind
args.info: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource. Value: the fixed string "api#channel".

args.name: id
args.info: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

args.name: resourceId
args.info: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

args.name: resourceUri
args.info: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

args.name: token
args.info: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

args.name: expiration
args.info: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

args.name: address
args.info: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel

args.name: payload
args.info: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted.

args.name: params
args.info: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior (key:value)

blocks.name: createFilePermission
blocks.description: Creates a permission for a file or Team Drive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: emailMessage
args.info: A custom message to include in the notification email.

args.name: sendNotificationEmail
args.info: Whether to send a notification email when sharing to users or groups. This defaults to true for users and groups, and is not allowed for other requests. It must not be disabled for ownership transfers.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: transferOwnership
args.info: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user and downgrade the current owner to a writer. This parameter is required as an acknowledgement of the side effect. (Default: false)

args.name: role
args.info: The role granted by this permission. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently allowed: "organizer", "owner", "writer", "commenter", "reader"

args.name: type
args.info: he type of the grantee. Valid values are: "user", "group", "domain", "anyone"

args.name: allowFileDiscovery
args.info: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search. This is only applicable for permissions of type domain or anyone.

args.name: domain
args.info: The domain to which this permission refers.

args.name: emailAddress
args.info: The email address of the user or group to which this permission refers.

blocks.name: deleteFilePermission
blocks.description: Deletes a permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: permissionId
args.info: The ID of the permission.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

blocks.name: getFileSinglePermission
blocks.description: Gets a permission by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: permissionId
args.info: The ID of the permission.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

blocks.name: getFilePermissions
blocks.description: Lists a file's or Team Drive's permissions.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of permissions to return per page. When not set for files in a Team Drive, at most 100 results will be returned. When not set for files that are not in a Team Drive, the entire list will be returned. Acceptable values are 1 to 100, inclusive.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

blocks.name: updateFilePermission
blocks.description: Updates a permission with patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: permissionId
args.info: The ID of the permission.

args.name: removeExpiration
args.info: Whether to remove the expiration date. (Default: false)

args.name: supportsTeamDrives
args.info: Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. (Default: false)

args.name: transferOwnership
args.info: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user and downgrade the current owner to a writer. This parameter is required as an acknowledgement of the side effect. (Default: false)

args.name: expirationTime
args.info: The time at which this permission will expire (RFC 3339 date-time). Expiration times have the following restrictions: They can only be set on user and group permissions. The time must be in the future. The time cannot be more than a year in the future

args.name: role
args.info: The role granted by this permission. While new values may be supported in the future, the following are currently allowed: "organizer", "owner", "writer", "commenter", "reader"

blocks.name: createReplyToComment
blocks.description: Creates a new reply to a comment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: action
args.info: The action the reply performed to the parent comment. Valid values are:, "resolve", "reopen"

args.name: content
args.info: The plain text content of the reply. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed. This is required on creates if no action is specified.

blocks.name: deleteCommentReply
blocks.description: Deletes a reply.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: replyId
args.info: The ID of the reply.

blocks.name: getSingleReply
blocks.description: Gets a reply by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: replyId
args.info: The ID of the reply.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: Whether to return deleted replies. Deleted replies will not include their original content. (Default: false)

blocks.name: getCommentReplies
blocks.description: Lists a comment's replies.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fileId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: Whether to return deleted replies. Deleted replies will not include their original content. (Default: false)

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of replies to return per page. Acceptable values are 1 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 20)

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

blocks.name: updateCommentReply
blocks.description: Updates a reply with patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The ID of the comment.

args.name: replyId
args.info: The ID of the reply.

args.name: content
args.info: The plain text content of the reply. This field is used for setting the content, while htmlContent should be displayed. This is required on creates if no action is specified.

blocks.name: deleteFileRevision
blocks.description: Permanently deletes a revision. This method is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: revisionId
args.info: The ID of the revision.

blocks.name: getFileSingleRevision
blocks.description: Gets a revision's metadata or content by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: revisionId
args.info: The ID of the revision.

blocks.name: getFileRevisions
blocks.description: Lists a file's revisions.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The maximum number of revisions to return per page. Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive. (Default: 200)

args.name: pageToken
args.info: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

blocks.name: updateFileRevision
blocks.description: Updates a revision with patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: fieldId
args.info: The ID of the file.

args.name: revisionId
args.info: The ID of the revision.

args.name: keepForever
args.info: Whether to keep this revision forever, even if it is no longer the head revision. If not set, the revision will be automatically purged 30 days after newer content is uploaded. This can be set on a maximum of 200 revisions for a file. This field is only applicable to files with binary content in Drive.

args.name: publishAuto
args.info: Whether subsequent revisions will be automatically republished. This is only applicable to Google Docs.

args.name: published
args.info: Whether this revision is published. This is only applicable to Google Docs.

args.name: publishedOutsideDomain
args.info: Whether this revision is published outside the domain. This is only applicable to Google Docs.

blocks.name: createTeamDrive
blocks.description: Creates a new Team Drive.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: requestId
args.info: An ID, such as a random UUID, which uniquely identifies this user's request for idempotent creation of a Team Drive. A repeated request by the same user and with the same request ID will avoid creating duplicates by attempting to create the same Team Drive. If the Team Drive already exists a 409 error will be returned.

args.name: themeId
args.info: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible teamDriveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.teamdrives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

blocks.name: deleteTeamDrive
blocks.description: Permanently deletes a Team Drive for which the user is an organizer. The Team Drive cannot contain any untrashed items.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The ID of the Team Drive

blocks.name: getSingleTeamDrive
blocks.description: Gets a Team Drive's metadata by ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The ID of the Team Drive

blocks.name: getTeamDrives
blocks.description: Lists the user's Team Drives.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of Team Drives to return. Acceptable values are 1 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 10)

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Page token for Team Drives.

blocks.name: updateTeamDrive
blocks.description: Updates a Team Drive's metadata

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it

args.name: teamDriveId
args.info: The ID of the Team Drive

args.name: backgroundImageFileId
args.info: Id of image file. If set also set "backgroundImageFileWidth", "backgroundImageFileXCoordinate", "backgroundImageFileYCoordinate"

args.name: backgroundImageFileWidth
args.info: Width of image file. If set also set "backgroundImageFileId", "backgroundImageFileXCoordinate", "backgroundImageFileYCoordinate"

args.name: backgroundImageFileXCoordinate
args.info: xCoordinate of image file. If set also set "backgroundImageFileId", "backgroundImageFileWidth", "backgroundImageFileYCoordinate"

args.name: backgroundImageFileYCoordinate
args.info: xCoordinate of image file. If set also set "backgroundImageFileId", "backgroundImageFileWidth", "backgroundImageFileXCoordinate"

args.name: colorRgb
args.info: The color of this Team Drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.teamdrives.update request that does not set themeId.

args.name: themeId
args.info: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible teamDriveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.teamdrives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

blocks.name: scanFiles
blocks.description: Send file to VirusTotal

args.name: apikey
args.info: VirusTotal apikey

args.name: file
args.info: File to scan
